meanings.definition: a wild South American mammal similar to the llama, with a light brown coat and white underparts.
meanings.sent1: The guanacos grazed peacefully in the grassy meadow.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of guanacos at the zoo last weekend.
meanings.sent3: The guanacos decided to have a dance-off to determine the fastest runner.
meanings.sent4: Her hair flowed behind her like a herd of guanacos racing across the plains.
meanings.sent5: The children were mesmerized by the graceful movements of the guanacos.

meanings.definition: the plural form of guanaco, referring to more than one of these animals.
meanings.sent1: We spotted a herd of guanacos on our nature hike.
meanings.sent2: The guanacos in the enclosure were happily munching on grass.
meanings.sent3: The guanacos held a meeting to discuss their favorite grazing spots.
meanings.sent4: The field was alive with the sound of guanacos calling to each other.
meanings.sent5: The travelers marveled at the beauty of the roaming guanacos.
